MOTIONS FOR EXECUTIVE SESSION The following motions were adopted unanimously by the vote of all Visitors present: (a) That the Board of Visitors of the University of Virginia go into Executive Session for the purpose of consulting with the General Counsel concerning certain pending and potential litigation involving the University, as well as specific legal matters requiring the advice of counsel, as provided for in Section 2.1-344 (A) (7) of The Code of Virginia. (b) That the Audit Committee of the Board of Visitors of the University of Virginia go into Executive Session for the purpose of discussing and considering reports and recommendations of the University Auditor related to the recently completed fiscal audits and performance evaluations of certain University departments and programs, including the Department of Environmental Health and Safety, the Division of Continuing Education, Conferences and Institutes, the Department of Athletics, Hospital Security, the Payroll Department, the 1992 Game Settlements, Ambulatory Care Services, Medical Records, and Medical Center Computing and Radiology as provided for in Section 2.1-344 (A) (1) of The Code of Virginia. (c) That the Educational Policy Committee of the Board of Visitors go into Executive Session for the purpose of discussing personnel matters pertaining to (1) the appointment, assignment, reappointment, promotion, performance, compensation, separation and resignation of specific faculty members of the University of Virginia; and (2) duties and assignments of the Executive Staff, as provided for in Section 2.1-344 (A) (1) of The Code of Virginia. (d) That the Board of Visitors go into Executive Session for the purpose of discussing the appointment of the Chancellor of Clinch Valley College as provided for in Section 2.1-344 (A) (1) of The Code of Virginia.

ELECTION OF THE CHANCELLOR OF CLINCH VALLEY COLLEGE The President asked Dr. Hulvey as Chair of the Special Committee on Clinch Valley College and as a member of the Search Committee on the Chancellor for Clinch Valley College, to comment on the search process and to introduce the members of the Clinch Valley College Chancellor Search Committee who were present. Dr. Hulvey introduced Mr. Kenneth Asbury, Chair of the Clinch Valley College Chancellor Search Committee. Mr. Asbury reported that a portion of the membership of the Search Committee was present. He introduced Messrs. William Sturgill, Glenn Blackburn, Thomas Henritze, Raymond Haas, and Ms. Annette Gibbs and Ms. Rhonda Miller. Mr. Asbury thanked President Casteen for the support and assistance he had given the Committee during the search process. Dr. Hulvey introduced Mr. L. Jay Lemons and Mrs. Lemons and reported that Mr. Lemons was the unanimous choice of the Search Committee. Dr. Hulvey commented that Mr. Lemons has done an outstanding job as Interim Chancellor, a position he assumed last August. The following resolution was unanimously adopted: RESOLVED that Mr. L. Jay Lemons be and he is hereby elected Chancellor of Clinch Valley College, for five years, effective July 1, 1993. Until July 1, 1993, Mr. Lemons will be Interim Chancellor. Mr. Lemons expressed appreciation for this opportunity to serve the University of Virginia in a special way, and for the support that he and Mrs. Lemons have received during their time at Clinch Valley College.

RESOLUTION OF COMMENDATION TO JAMES SCOTT BALLENGER The following resolution was adopted: WHEREAS James Scott Ballenger was elected to the Board of Visitors as Student Member in March 1992; and WHEREAS Mr. Ballenger has a superb academic record as an undergraduate student, being both a Jefferson Scholar and an Echols Scholar, and is clearly a leader among his peers; and WHEREAS Mr. Ballenger has been a diligent and invaluable member of the Board of Visitors, serving with intelligence and discretion and bringing to his colleagues on the Board perspectives of the University they might otherwise not have had; and WHEREAS Mr. Ballenger has rejected many other attractive offers of admission to accept the offer of the School of Law of the University, and will matriculate on the North Grounds in the next Session; NOW THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED that the Board thanks Scott Ballenger for his friendship and for his devoted service to the Board of Visitors and to the University, commends him for the wisdom of his choice of law schools, notes with pleasure that he will be a student at the University of Virginia for three more years, and wishes him well as he begins his study of the law.

APPROVAL OF REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS AND SUPERVISORY STRUCTURE FOR DUAL EMPLOYMENT SITUATIONS The following resolution was adopted: WHEREAS the Virginia Conflict of Interest Act was amended by the 1993 General Assembly, to be effective July 1, 1993, to permit the dual employment of immediate family members by public institutions of higher education that would otherwise be prohibited by this statute, subject to the following conditions: (i) the officer or employee and the immediate family member are engaged in teaching, research, or administrative support positions at the educational institution, (ii) the governing board of the educational institution finds that it is in the best interest of the institution and the Commonwealth for such dual employment to exist, and (iii) after such finding, the board establishes and oversees the implementation of reporting relationships and a supervisory structure to ensure that the officer or employee, or the immediate family member, does not supervise, evaluate, or otherwise participate in personnel decisions regarding the other; WHEREAS the Department of English and the Dean of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences have recommended that Ms. Lotta L. Casteen be employed as a member of the faculty to teach courses; and WHEREAS President John T. Casteen, III, is an officer of the University and would accrue a personal interest in his spouse's employment contract; RESOLVED that the Board of Visitors finds it in the best interest of the University of Virginia and the Commonwealth to employ Ms. Lotta L. Casteen as a member of the faculty to teach courses in the Department of English; RESOLVED FURTHER that the reporting relationship and supervisory structure for Ms. Lotta L. Casteen shall be as follows: (a) All personnel matters will be handled in accordance with customary practices, with the faculty member reporting to the department chair, and the chair and the Dean of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences making recommendations regarding salary, faculty rank, performance evaluations, and other personnel matters to the Vice President and Provost; (b) The Vice President and Provost shall act in the stead of the President for all matters that would ordinarily require the President's action and will present to the Board of Visitors those matters which require its action.

ESTABLISHMENT OF A NEW DEPARTMENT IN THE SCHOOL OF MEDICINE: THE DEPARTMENT OF THERAPEUTIC RADIOLOGY AND ONCOLOGY The following resolution was adopted: WHEREAS there is a demonstrable need in the School of Medicine and the Health Sciences Center for instruction of medical students and physicians in the value and use of radiation in the treatment of cancer, to provide clinical services for the treatment of malignant disease with radiation, and to provide basic and clinical research on the biologic mechanism of radiation effects on normal and malignant tissues and the efficacy of radiation therapy; WHEREAS initial funding of the new department is to be accomplished by reallocation of funds from several Health Sciences Center sources, including funds currently supporting the Division of Radiological Physics; WHEREAS this action is proposed by the Dean of the School of Medicine and supported by the Vice President and Provost for Health Sciences, and the President; NOW THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED that there is created within the School of Medicine a Department of Therapeutic Radiology and Oncology. This action is subject to final approval of the State Council of Higher Education of Virginia.

APPROVAL TO DESIGNATE CURRENT OPERATING CASH BALANCES FOR OUTSTANDING CAPITAL COMMITMENTS The following resolution was adopted: WHEREAS the University of Virginia Medical Center has outstanding capital commitments of $27.8 million as of February 28, 1993, of which $24.5 million are for capital items included in the Medical Center's fiscal year 1992 and fiscal year 1993 capital budgets approved by the Board of Visitors, and $3.3 million are for Phase I planning associated with the ambulatory care and related facilities project appropriated by the State; and WHEREAS the Medical Center desires to specifically designate a portion of its cash balance to be used to fund these capital commitments; RESOLVED that the Board of Visitors authorize the Medical Center to designate from its current operating cash balance, after meeting its working capital requirements, a sum sufficient to cover its outstanding capital commitments, not to exceed $27.8 million.

APPROVAL TO AMEND THE UNIVERSITY'S REFUND POLICY FOR TUITION AND FEES, ROOM AND BOARD The following resolution was adopted: WHEREAS the Federal Reauthorization of Higher Education Act requires institutions of higher education to offer pro rata refunds through 60% of the semester for students completely withdrawing from school, who are attending the University for the first time and are receiving Title IV financial aid; RESOLVED that the University's refund policy for tuition and fees, room and board be amended as follows: Pro Rata Refund Policy A student who is attending the University for the first time (undergraduate, graduate, or transfer), who is receiving Title IV financial aid, and who withdraws completely from the University, will be eligible for a pro rata refund as follows: applicable tuition, fees, room, and board charges will be pro-rated on a weekly basis for the first 60 percent for the semester. The Bursar's Office will deduct an administrative fee of $100 or 5% of the applicable charges, whichever is less, before processing the refund. The actual percentage charged the student will be calculated by dividing the number of weeks the student has attended within the semester as determined by the last recorded date of attendance, by the number of academic weeks within the semester. After 60 percent of the semester has passed, no refunds will be granted.

APPROVAL FOR THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER TO DISINVEST PRINCIPAL OF THE UNRESTRICTED QUASI-ENDOWMENT TO FUND CAPITAL CAMPAIGN EXPENSES The following resolution was adopted: WHEREAS the University needs to expand its Development operation to support the Capital Campaign; and WHEREAS income from the unrestricted endowment is insufficient to fund the level of expenditures necessary; and WHEREAS a permanent funding mechanism for supporting an expanded development effort must be devised; and WHEREAS the revenue generated from the permanent funding mechanism will lag the needed expenditures in the Development Office, RESOLVED that the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer be and he is hereby authorized to disinvest up to $3,300,000 from principal of the unrestricted quasi-endowment as needed to fund additional operating expenses incurred by the Development Office in 1993-1994, for campaign activities. The Chief Financial Officer will be required to report to the Board of Visitors, on a quarterly basis, the amount disinvested, RESOLVED FURTHER that the amount disinvested will be repaid as campaign gifts are collected.

RESOLUTION APPROVING ENROLLMENT PROJECTIONS, 1993-1996 The following resolution was adopted: WHEREAS the State revised enrollment plan now calls for growth in the number of University students by the end of the 1994-96 biennium; and WHEREAS the Board believes that maintenance of the excellence of the University and its improvement is its primary duty and that any growth must be planned and financed so as to permit that duty to be performed; RESOLVED that undergraduate enrollment in the University be increased by approximately 400 headcount students by 1995-96 compared with the 1992-93 academic year, and that all growth shall maintain the current mix of in-state and out-of-state students; and RESOLVED FURTHER that the University will request general fund appropriations equal to the State's share of the educational and general cost related to the additional students as part of its 1994-96 biennial budget; and NOW THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED that this resolution reaffirms the January 1990 action of the Board of Visitors pertaining to enrollment growth and resources, except for the provision as stated above.
